video.title: Django For Everybody - Full Python University Course
video.description:
This Django tutorial aims to teach everyone the Python Django web development framework.

🔗 Course Website: https://www.dj4e.com/
💻 Sample Code: https://github.com/csev/dj4e-samples/

✏️ This course was created by Dr. Charles Severance (a.k.a. Dr. Chuck). He is a Professor at the University of Michigan School of Information, where he teaches various technology-oriented courses including programming, database design, and Web development.

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
00:00:00 Why Teach Django?

topLevelComment.author: Alexander Hyll
topLevelComment.text: One reason web dev comes up so high for python could simply be separated front- and backends. A lot of front end is written in js etc, but as soon as you handle more data separating front from back and using python makes s lot of sense. If i had to guess I dont think most people are using as much from the template/frontend side of django.

replies.author: Aabid Ismail
replies.text: super() references to the parent class of a given class. for example, super().__init__() simply executes the constructor of the parent class from the child class

topLevelComment.author: Who am I
topLevelComment.text:
Embarrassed to admit I a judged a video by its thumbnail. Because I’ve used Python for automation in genomics and dna/rna extractions via robotics I had a big head to put it mildly. Django is different than standard Python and libraries for ML, Analytics, or Robotics.

If you are still reading this you can no doubt start with Django learning Python.!!!
Too often people try to learn a language or “programming” and “coding” but have to no idea what they are going to make, or what problem they intend to solve.
This course provides real experience not a repeat of the main projects repeated by to many people reading the docs aloud and making the Polls app or Library app. 

# I do disagree with 1 comment in the 18 hours video series.  RUST will reign supreme (one day, maybe, I hope)!!!!!!!

topLevelComment.author: M. M
topLevelComment.text:
The missing part about how you set up the web application: 
1) + Add a new web app.
2) Select manual configuration
3) Python 3.8 (it's important)
4) Change the Source Code: home/your-python-anywhere-acc/django_projects/mysite
    Change the Working Directory: home/your-python-anywhere-acc/django_projects/mysite
    Edit the WSGI configuration file: click on the link (no need to change the link), Cope and Paste the following:
import os
import sys

path = os.path.expanduser('~/django_projects/mysite')
if path not in sys.path:
    sys.path.insert(0, path)
os.environ['DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE'] = 'mysite.settings'
from django.core.wsgi import get_wsgi_application
from django.contrib.staticfiles.handlers import StaticFilesHandler
application = StaticFilesHandler(get_wsgi_application())
5)  Add the Virtual Environment's path: : home/your-python-anywhere-acc/.virtualenvs./django3 (if it shows that u got different Python version go back to Step 3.

Spent few hours to figure out where is missed the whole thing up LOL!!

This kind of behind-the-scenes knowledge is what separates a good developer from a truly great one.
